revised_title: Pair Correlation Function in Fluids with Density Inhomogeneities: Hard Spheres Near a Hard Wall
tldr: This article presents a study on the pair correlation function and density profile of a system of hard spheres near a hard wall using the Percus-Yevick and hypernetted chain approximations. The results show that the Percus-Yevick approximation is similar in accuracy to the bulk fluid, while the hypernetted chain approximation is more challenging to obtain numerically and less accurate. Both approximations predict the correct asymmetries between the values of the pair correlation functions for pairs of hard spheres parallel or normal to the surface of the wall.
